verses.kjv: Now faith is the substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things not seen.
verses.ct: Faith is the foundation of what we hope for and the proof of realities we cannot see.

verses.kjv: For by it the elders obtained a good report.
verses.ct: It was because of their faith that the people of long ago earned God's approval.

verses.kjv: Through faith we understand that the worlds were framed by the word of God, so that things which are seen were not made of things which do appear.
verses.ct: Through faith we recognize that the universe was shaped by God's command, so that what is visible was not made from anything that can be observed.

verses.kjv: By faith Abel offered unto God a more excellent sacrifice than Cain, by which he obtained witness that he was righteous, God testifying of his gifts: and by it he being dead yet speaketh.
verses.ct: Through faith, Abel presented a superior sacrifice to God compared to Cain's. Because of this, God acknowledged him as righteous, confirming it through his gifts. And even though Abel is dead, his faith still speaks.

verses.kjv: By faith Enoch was translated that he should not see death; and was not found, because God had translated him: for before his translation he had this testimony, that he pleased God.
verses.ct: Through faith, Enoch was taken away so that he would never experience death. He could not be found, because God had taken him. Before he was taken, he had the reputation of someone who pleased God.

verses.kjv: But without faith it is impossible to please him: for he that cometh to God must believe that he is, and that he is a rewarder of them that diligently seek him.
verses.ct: Without faith, it is impossible to please God. Anyone who approaches God must believe that he exists and that he rewards those who earnestly pursue him.

verses.kjv: By faith Noah, being warned of God of things not seen as yet, moved with fear, prepared an ark to the saving of his house; by the which he condemned the world, and became heir of the righteousness which is by faith.
verses.ct: Through faith, Noah, after being warned by God about things that hadn't happened yet, responded with reverent obedience and built an ark to rescue his family. By doing this, he exposed the guilt of the world and inherited the righteousness that comes through faith.

verses.kjv: By faith Abraham, when he was called to go out into a place which he should after receive for an inheritance, obeyed; and he went out, not knowing whither he went.
verses.ct: Through faith, Abraham obeyed when God called him to leave for a place he would later receive as an inheritance. He set out without knowing where he was going.

verses.kjv: By faith he sojourned in the land of promise, as in a strange country, dwelling in tabernacles with Isaac and Jacob, the heirs with him of the same promise:
verses.ct: Through faith, he settled as a foreigner in the promised land, living in tents alongside Isaac and Jacob, who shared the same promise.

verses.kjv: For he looked for a city which hath foundations, whose builder and maker is God.
verses.ct: He was looking forward to a city with permanent foundations, designed and built by God.

verses.kjv: Through faith also Sara herself received strength to conceive seed, and was delivered of a child when she was past age, because she judged him faithful who had promised.
verses.ct: Through faith, Sarah herself was given the ability to become pregnant, even though she was well past the age for it, because she considered God trustworthy to keep his promise.

verses.kjv: Therefore sprang there even of one, and him as good as dead, so many as the stars of the sky in multitude, and as the sand which is by the sea shore innumerable.
verses.ct: So from one man — and one who was practically dead — came descendants as numerous as the stars in the heavens and as countless as the grains of sand along the seashore.

verses.kjv: These all died in faith, not having received the promises, but having seen them afar off, and were persuaded of them, and embraced them, and confessed that they were strangers and pilgrims on the earth.
verses.ct: All of these people died still holding onto their faith. They never received what was promised, but they saw it from a distance and welcomed it, openly admitting that they were outsiders and temporary residents on this earth.

verses.kjv: For they that say such things declare plainly that they seek a country.
verses.ct: People who talk like that make it clear they are searching for a homeland.

verses.kjv: And truly, if they had been mindful of that country from whence they came out, they might have had opportunity to have returned.
verses.ct: If they had been thinking about the country they had left behind, they would have had the chance to go back.

verses.kjv: But now they desire a better country, that is, an heavenly: wherefore God is not ashamed to be called their God: for he hath prepared for them a city.
verses.ct: Instead, they longed for a better homeland — a heavenly one. That is why God is not embarrassed to be called their God, because he has built a city for them.

verses.kjv: By faith Abraham, when he was tried, offered up Isaac: and he that had received the promises offered up his only begotten son,
verses.ct: Through faith, Abraham, when he was tested, offered up Isaac. The very man who had received God's promises was willing to sacrifice his one and only son,

verses.kjv: Of whom it was said, That in Isaac shall thy seed be called:
verses.ct: even though God had told him, 'Your descendants will be traced through Isaac.'

verses.kjv: Accounting that God was able to raise him up, even from the dead; from whence also he received him in a figure.
verses.ct: Abraham reasoned that God had the power to raise Isaac from the dead, and in a sense, that is exactly what happened.

verses.kjv: By faith Isaac blessed Jacob and Esau concerning things to come.
verses.ct: Through faith, Isaac spoke blessings over Jacob and Esau regarding their futures.

verses.kjv: By faith Jacob, when he was a dying, blessed both the sons of Joseph; and worshipped, leaning upon the top of his staff.
verses.ct: Through faith, Jacob, as he was dying, blessed each of Joseph's sons and worshiped while leaning on the top of his staff.

verses.kjv: By faith Joseph, when he died, made mention of the departing of the children of Israel; and gave commandment concerning his bones.
verses.ct: Through faith, Joseph, near the end of his life, spoke about the future departure of the Israelites from Egypt and gave instructions about what to do with his bones.

verses.kjv: By faith Moses, when he was born, was hid three months of his parents, because they saw he was a proper child; and they were not afraid of the king’s commandment.
verses.ct: Through faith, Moses' parents hid him for 3 months after he was born, because they could see he was an extraordinary child, and they were not intimidated by the king's order.

verses.kjv: By faith Moses, when he was come to years, refused to be called the son of Pharaoh’s daughter;
verses.ct: Through faith, Moses, once he had grown up, refused to be identified as the son of Pharaoh's daughter.

verses.kjv: Choosing rather to suffer affliction with the people of God, than to enjoy the pleasures of sin for a season;
verses.ct: He chose to endure hardship alongside God's people rather than enjoy the temporary pleasures of sin.

verses.kjv: Esteeming the reproach of Christ greater riches than the treasures in Egypt: for he had respect unto the recompence of the reward.
verses.ct: He considered the disgrace of following Christ to be greater wealth than all the treasures of Egypt, because he was focused on the coming reward.

verses.kjv: By faith he forsook Egypt, not fearing the wrath of the king: for he endured, as seeing him who is invisible.
verses.ct: Through faith, he left Egypt without being afraid of the king's fury. He persevered because he kept his eyes on the God who cannot be seen.

verses.kjv: Through faith he kept the passover, and the sprinkling of blood, lest he that destroyed the firstborn should touch them.
verses.ct: Through faith, he established the Passover and the application of blood, so that the destroyer of the firstborn would not strike them.

verses.kjv: By faith they passed through the Red sea as by dry land: which the Egyptians assaying to do were drowned.
verses.ct: Through faith, the people crossed the Red Sea on dry ground, but when the Egyptians tried to follow, they were swallowed by the water.

verses.kjv: By faith the walls of Jericho fell down, after they were compassed about seven days.
verses.ct: Through faith, the walls of Jericho collapsed after the people had marched around them for 7 days.

verses.kjv: By faith the harlot Rahab perished not with them that believed not, when she had received the spies with peace.
verses.ct: Through faith, Rahab the prostitute was not destroyed along with those who disobeyed, because she had welcomed the Israelite spies in peace.

verses.kjv: And what shall I more say? for the time would fail me to tell of Gedeon, and of Barak, and of Samson, and of Jephthae; of David also, and Samuel, and of the prophets:
verses.ct: What more can I say? I don't have enough time to tell about Gedeon, Barak, Samson, Jephthae, David, Samuel, and the prophets.

verses.kjv: Who through faith subdued kingdoms, wrought righteousness, obtained promises, stopped the mouths of lions,
verses.ct: Through faith, these people conquered kingdoms, carried out righteousness, received what God promised, and shut the mouths of lions.

verses.kjv: Quenched the violence of fire, escaped the edge of the sword, out of weakness were made strong, waxed valiant in fight, turned to flight the armies of the aliens.
verses.ct: They extinguished raging fires, escaped death by the sword, found strength in their weakness, became powerful in battle, and routed foreign armies.

verses.kjv: Women received their dead raised to life again: and others were tortured, not accepting deliverance; that they might obtain a better resurrection:
verses.ct: Women received their loved ones back from death. Others endured torture and refused to accept release, so they could gain a superior resurrection.

verses.kjv: And others had trial of cruel mockings and scourgings, yea, moreover of bonds and imprisonment:
verses.ct: Still others faced the ordeal of ridicule and whipping, and even chains and prison.

verses.kjv: They were stoned, they were sawn asunder, were tempted, were slain with the sword: they wandered about in sheepskins and goatskins; being destitute, afflicted, tormented;
verses.ct: They were stoned, sawed in half, put to the test, and killed with swords. They roamed around wearing sheepskins and goatskins, living in poverty, persecuted, and mistreated.

verses.kjv: (Of whom the world was not worthy:) they wandered in deserts, and in mountains, and in dens and caves of the earth.
verses.ct: The world did not deserve them. They wandered through deserts and mountains, hiding in caves and holes in the ground.

verses.kjv: And these all, having obtained a good report through faith, received not the promise:
verses.ct: All of these people earned God's approval through their faith, yet none of them received what had been ultimately promised.

verses.kjv: God having provided some better thing for us, that they without us should not be made perfect.
verses.ct: God had planned something better that included us, so that they would not reach completion apart from us.
